etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London. From scientific Latin Myxine, apparently (with alteration of the ending) from Hellenistic Greek μυξῖνος slime-fish from ancient Greek μύξα mucus + -ῖνος, suffix forming nouns

definitions: A hagfish; specifically the Atlantic hagfish, Myxine glutinosa (family Myxinidae); (in form Myxine) the genus which includes this species.

notes.text: Valid publication of the genus name: Linnaeus Systema Naturae (ed. 10, 1758) I. 650.
